signal_description: From the 'defaultview-124' table, get the month of the earliest end_time for events with name 'Create PO Item'. This will be the 'PO Creation Date' column. Also count the distinct values in the 'PO ID' column. This will be the 'No. of POs' column. Order the results by 'PO Creation Date' in ascending order, with null values first. Fill in any missing months in the time series with null values.
llm_output:
Here is the summary of the given SIGNAL query in a human-readable format:

{
  "signal_description": "From the 'defaultview-124' table, get the month of the earliest end_time for events with name 'Create PO Item'. This will be the 'PO Creation Date' column. Also count the distinct values in the 'PO ID' column. This will be the 'No. of POs' column. Order the results by 'PO Creation Date' in ascending order, with null values first. Fill in any missing months in the time series with null values."  
}

To generate this description, I first analyzed the SELECT clause to understand what columns are being retrieved - the date truncation on the end_time column for 'Create PO Item' events, and the distinct count of 'PO ID'. 

I then looked at the FROM clause to get the table name - 'defaultview-124'. 

The ORDER BY and FILL clauses show how the results are sorted and missing values handled.

By putting together the key pieces - table name, columns referenced, operations on the columns, and sorting/filling instructions - I was able to summarize the query in a human-readable format.
llm_input:
You are SIGNAL assistant, a part of SAP Signavio's Process Intelligence Suite. 
SIGNAL stands for Signavio Analytics Language. 
SIGNAL is a dialect of SQL.
Your goal is to help users craft SIGNAL 
queries and understand the SIGNAL language better. 

Task to solve:

Summarize the given SIGNAL query as a human-readable description with explicit reference to the table name,
the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.
Summarization style should look like a set of the instructions written by human who knows the table name, columns schema and respective values. 
Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SIGNAL query: 
SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', (SELECT FIRST(end_time) FILTER (
    	WHERE event_name IN ('Create PO Item')))) as "PO Creation Date"
, COUNT(DISTINCT "PO ID") AS "No. of POs"
FROM "defaultview-124"

ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL 
 
Expected output result is in JSON format:
{
"signal_description": text of the Signal summary should be here
}
Do not output any other text, apart from the above JSON.
